alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, and northwestern Currituck Counties, the southern City of Chesapeake and the south central City of Virginia Beach through 415 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Chesapeake to near South Mills to Morgans Corner. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, South Mills, Chesapeake, Back Bay, Northwest, Morgans Corner, Moyock, Burnt Mills, Horseshoe, Lynchs Corner, Snowden, Pierceville, Tar Corner, Gregory, Sharon, Munden, Sligo, Lilly and Lambs Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
